info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, southwestern Polk and north central Greenville Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Hendersonville, or near Flat Rock, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Saluda, Laurel Park, Jones Gap State Park, Valley Hill, Tuxedo, North Saluda Reservoir, Crab Creek and East Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
